alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Cumberland; Kennebec; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 13 at 5:45PM EDT until August 13 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN KENNEBEC...SOUTHERN ANDROSCOGGIN...NORTHEASTERN CUMBERLAND AND NORTHWESTERN SAGADAHOC COUNTIES... At 544 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Litchfield to 7 miles east of Lewiston to Auburn, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Auburn, Mechanic Falls, Topsham, Litchfield, Winthrop, Lisbon, Greene, Durham, Bowdoin, Bowdoinham, Leeds, New Gloucester, Wales, Monmouth, Sabattus, Poland, Richmond, Minot, and West Gardiner. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 near mile marker 47. Interstate 95 between mile markers 69 and 99. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near lakes, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
